titles.title: Child Support Protection Act of 2011
A bill to reinstate Federal matching of State spending of child support incentive payments.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S282)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 1/26/2011--Introduced. Child Support Protection Act of 2011 - Amends part D (Child Support and Establishment of Paternity) of title IV of the Social Security Act to repeal the exclusion from federal matching payments of any amounts expended by a state from child support incentive payments it has received from the Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS). (Thus reinstates federal matching of state spending of child support incentive payments.)
